types.html:
zone pellucide f (plural zones pellucides)

  1. a zona pellucida, a pellucid zone
    • 1997, Pierre Validire (French translator), Alan Stevens and James Lowe (English authors), Histologie humaine (English title Human Histology), De Boeck Université, →ISBN, page 340:
      La sécrétion continue de FSH induit la multiplication des cellules folliculaires, qui se stratifient et forment la granulosa autour de l’ovocyte en croissance, main en restent séparées par une couche matériel glycoprotéique éosinophile (PAS positif) (Fig 17.19a). Cette couche, la zone pellucide, est traversée par des microvillosités ovocytaires et par des prolongements cytoplasmiques fins de la couche interne des cellules de la granulosa. [boldface in original]
      Continuing FSH secretion then induces the granulosa cells to divide to produce a multilayered surround to [sic] the enlarging oocyte, while a distinct glycoprotein layer of eosinophilic (PAS-positive) material forms between the oocyte and these cells (Fig. 17.19a). This layer is called the zona pellucida and is traversed by microvilli protruding outwards from the oocyte and by thin cytoplasmic processes from the inner layer of the granulosa cells. [boldface in original]

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Like its English counterparts, and like technical names for many anatomical structures, zone pellucide is most commonly used in the singular, and with the definite article, as in the above quotation.
trans: a zona pellucida, a pellucid zone

title: zone pellucide
pronunHtml: • (France): IPA(key): /zon pe.ly.sid/
